Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.gameControl.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputEventListener
public class GameController extends Object implements InputEventListener
Adapter that connects the UI-level GuiController with the core GameEngine logic.

This class implements InputEventListener and translates UI events (move, rotate, drop, swap) into engine operations while keeping the view updated. It delegates rules/state changes to GameEngine and the underlying Board for testability.

    • GameController

      public GameController(GuiController c)

  • Method Details

    • setClearRowHandler

      public void setClearRowHandler(Consumer<Integer> handler)
      Provide a handler that will be called when rows are cleared as a result of a drop. The handler receives the number of forward (non-garbage) cleared rows.
      Parameters:
      handler - consumer receiving cleared-row count (may be null)

    • addGarbageRows

      public void addGarbageRows(int count, int holeColumn)
      Add garbage rows to the current board and refresh the visible board. This method is safe to call from external systems (network/AI) and will log and ignore unexpected exceptions.
      Parameters:
      count - number of garbage rows to add
      holeColumn - index of the hole column in the garbage rows

    • getScoreProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty getScoreProperty()

    • getUpcomingBricks

      public List<Brick> getUpcomingBricks(int count)
      Return the upcoming bricks from the engine for preview purposes.
      Parameters:
      count - number of upcoming bricks to retrieve
      Returns:
      list of upcoming bricks (never null)

      Description copied from interface: InputEventListener
      Handle a down-type input (soft/hard drop or repeated down).
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Returns:
